messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] time magazine
messages.msgSnippet: I think the problem is, several people wrote the article, some supporting and some opposing causing many contradictions. Johanna Life is the ultimate learning
messages.messageBody:
I think the problem is, several people wrote the article, some supporting
and some opposing causing many contradictions.
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!

messages.msgSnippet: I really think it is a case of the ol subconscious feeling threatened kinda thing, if it was good enough for me, why isn t it good enough, blah, blah, blah.
messages.messageBody:
I really think it is a case of the ol' subconscious feeling threatened kinda
thing, "if it was good enough for me, why isn't it good enough, blah, blah,
blah." Ya know, kinda like homeschoolers trying to make them feel inferior.

which means, as you say, they just don't get it!

Lynda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] time magazine
messages.msgSnippet: I accessed this article earlier today and started reading it. The reporter had made several grammar mistakes and the tone was condescending. I was unable to
messages.messageBody:
I accessed this article earlier today and started reading it. The reporter
had made several grammar mistakes and the tone was condescending. I was
unable to finish reading it and tried several times this evening to access
it again and I keep getting error messages" this page cannot be displayed".
Has anyone else had difficulty with it?
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: "Castle Crawford" <ec3forme@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, August 19, 2001 10:13 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] time magazine


> wow. I just read the whole thing and I can say I feel less than inspired!
It seemed like each time a good point about homeschooling was brought up,
the writer had 2 more points that made it seem like maybe not such a good
idea. Even on the "How to get started" page, the last paragraph was nothing
less than depressing.
>
> The only valid point I saw FOR putting my kids in public education was the
line that read "Home schooling is a social threat to public education,"
says Chris Lubienski, who teaches at Iowa State University's college of
education. "It is taking some of the most affluent and articulate parents
out of the system. These are the parents who know how to get things done
with administrators." That still did not have me setting my alarm to get
Jake enrolled first thing in the morning with the rest of middle
Tennessee...
>
> All in all, an interesting article. Thanks for sharing the link, I never
would have read it otherwise!
>
> Esther
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: tanyab2@...
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Sunday, August 19, 2001 8:56 PM
> Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] time magazine

ecsamhill@... writes:


> I'd like to write a rebuttal, but it's hard to decide where to start.
>

>
>

I'm not sure it's worthy of an actual rebuttal but here's what I wrote:


Subj: The 8/20/01 Homeschooling Article
Date: 08/20/2001 2:25:47 PM !!!First Boot!!!
From: Marbleface
To: daily@...
CC: Marbleface



Couldn't TIME find reporters who weren't clearly biased against homeschooling?

This article is laughable.

Nance Confer
marbleface@...



Have fun!

Nance

messages.messageBody:
Ever get the feeling that some people just don't "get it"...

The person who wrote that article isn't very intelligent or open to reality.

But that is just my opinion :)

-Kristi

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] time magazine
messages.msgSnippet: ... What a perverse and annoying article!  Definitely the worst major homeschooling article I have read in a long time.  Very biased and full of
messages.messageBody:
> Time magazines cover story of the week on homeschooling.
> http://www.time.com/time/covers/1101010827/index.html
>
>

What a perverse and annoying article! Definitely the worst major homeschooling article I have read in a long time. Very biased and full of misconceptions.

I'd like to write a rebuttal, but it's hard to decide where to start.

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] time magazine
messages.msgSnippet: wow.  I just read the whole thing and I can say I feel less than inspired!  It seemed like each time a good point about homeschooling was brought up, the
messages.messageBody:
wow. I just read the whole thing and I can say I feel less than inspired! It seemed like each time a good point about homeschooling was brought up, the writer had 2 more points that made it seem like maybe not such a good idea. Even on the "How to get started" page, the last paragraph was nothing less than depressing.

The only valid point I saw FOR putting my kids in public education was the line that read "Home schooling is a social threat to public education," says Chris Lubienski, who teaches at Iowa State University's college of education. "It is taking some of the most affluent and articulate parents out of the system. These are the parents who know how to get things done with administrators." That still did not have me setting my alarm to get Jake enrolled first thing in the morning with the rest of middle Tennessee...

All in all, an interesting article. Thanks for sharing the link, I never would have read it otherwise!

Esther
----- Original Message -----
From: tanyab2@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, August 19, 2001 8:56 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] time magazine


Time magazines cover story of the week on homeschooling.
http://www.time.com/time/covers/1101010827/index.html
